summary:
Fordham University is a private research university in New York City, founded in 1841. It's the oldest Catholic and Jesuit university in the northeast U.S. Originally named St. John's College, it was later taken over by the Society of Jesus (Jesuits). Fordham has three campuses in New York and offers degrees in over 60 subjects.

The university is known for its successful athletic teams, especially football and baseball. Notable alumni include former President Donald Trump, several U.S. Senators, and many successful actors and business people.
title: Fordham University
